description:
Arrivals from foreign countries

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
12711 Migration statistics

Definition:
Arrivals are registrations of persons who moved into their
sole or main residence in a specific municipality.
Included are only persons who are part of the population.
Every arrival of any person within the reference period is
counted. Changes of residence within a municipality are not
covered.
Guests in accommodation units and the like and people
visiting relatives or friends are covered only if they stay
in the municipality for a longer period of time in
accordance with the registration regulations of the relevant
Land and if they are actually registered with the
registration authority.
Soldiers performing compulsory military service or reserve
duty training and persons performing alternative service are
not covered because they are not obliged to register.
Other persons not covered are part of the people living in
institutions (for example, patients in hospitals, etc.),
members of consular staff and of foreign armed forces
stationed in the Federal Republic of Germany, sailors and
inland waterways boatmen, professional soldiers and
fixed-term military personnel in case of temporary absence
from their base and similar special cases.
Any person transferring their main residence from a
municipality located in the territory of the Federal
Republic of Germany to another are counted as arrivals in
the new municipality and as departures in the previous
municipality (internal migration). Notwithstanding this
provision, persons moving from a foreign country to a
municipality located in the territory of the Federal
Republic are covered only as arrivals. Migration across the
borders of the Federal Republic of Germany is referred to as
federal external migration.

Changes over time:
Until and including 1964, federal external migration also
included migration between Berlin (West) and the rest of the
territory of the Federal Republic.
Until April 1983, arrivals also included cases where persons
returned to their main residence, abandoning their second
residence, or where persons returned to their first second
residence, abandoning their second second residence.
Persons deregistering from their second residence without
indicating a new residence were registered as arrivals in
the municipality in which their main residence was located.

Relations between concepts:
The difference between the number of arrivals and the number
of departures (migration statistics) is the net migration of
any municipality.
As regards internal migration, the number of arrivals
recorded in the Land of destination is not exactly identical
with the number of departures recorded in the Land of
departure. The balance of these differences - part of which
are due to technical reasons, part are due to differences in
definitions in the registration acts of the Länder - is
shown as the internal migration difference.
